In this story I feel no realy pity for the husband and he only has himself to blame since the wife was reluctant to the whole thing while the husband in turn sold his wife, though to be fair it's hella sketchy that just cause he made a bad deal he would have to pay for the companies losses. This seems to be a recuring theme but I find it hella weird that if they fail a deal they have to shoulder the losses while it they make the deal they get paid their normal salary.

@zen3rd1234 I think the fact that cheating is illegal in JP helps quite a bit in that it becomes something forbidden. The illegal part for cheating is for married or engaged to be married ppl. However the engaged part is very broad and subjective. For instance if your boyfriend + girlfriend and let's say the girlfriend cheats and the boyfriend was dating her with the intention of marriage their engaged, from what I've read. Most often it requires that multiple ppl are aware of their relationship and/or they've made it public. But yeah I think there isn't any jail time though I believe there is a fine and/or that your allowed to sue your cheating partner for compensation. There is also a social stigma involved with it, with multiple articles about ppl being fired or ostracized by their families for cheating.

Damn. I'm not into NTR (Don't hate it. Just not my cup of tea. But I do like some of them but it's pretty rare.) but I'm really fascinated how NTR artists creates stories like this. Very erotic but at the same time, full of sadness, pain and guilt.  Been reading the author's other works and, in my opinion, I can say that he's really good.
